website_summaries.verdict: Premium ping-pong paddle that delivers a great combination of power and speed.
pros: Body consists of two layers, including rubber and acrylic, for optimal quality
Ultra-lightweight, ensuring you can swing the paddle quickly and effortlessly
Features five-ply  blade and excellent control
cons: Grip may wear down with extended use

customer_reviews.title: Good quality material, Suitable for serious recreational play
customer_reviews.text: Got the racket/bat/paddle today and immediately noticed that the assembly is poor. Material seems high quality, but assembly is not. On the backhand side the black rubber wasn't flat, had multiple small to medium sized bulges, making the racket completely unusable. I have requested a replacement, and once I receive it, I will update the rating as well as the review. EDIT: I got the replacement and it's all good now. I would rate this racket highly for beginner to intermediate players. If you are below 1200 rated, you will be ok with this. Anything beyond that, you will need to invest in a custom-made solution.
customer_reviews.author: WittyB

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: i decided to buy it based on the reviews but i regret it! it is too slow and two delicate. The speed rating should be around 50, not 99! its spin is ok, but not like the description. I think it is not worth the money at all. It`s cheap quality as a whole!
customer_reviews.author: Masoud 5912

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners to break into more advanced play
customer_reviews.text: Love this paddle, it's my first one that I've gotten since starting to play about half a year ago at work. Before that I'd only used the crappy ones at work that were who knows how many years old and falling apart. This paddle made a HUGE difference! I actually started feeling like trying to put spins on the ball made a difference! After playing with this paddle for a few months, I'm spinning and chopping with ball on level with some of the people who have been playing for years. Some of my coworkers have other paddles they've bought which I've tried, but this one just feels the best to me. Lightweight with good speed and spin!
customer_reviews.author: Tony L.

customer_reviews.title: Great bat, just buy some cleaner to keep the rubbers in top shape.
customer_reviews.text: We have a table at work and a lot of people decided to bring their own bats in to play. I tried other people's out and found some I liked, but decided to order this one based on reviews here. I find a lot more of my hits stay on the table now and my game has improved significantly. A few people I work with have ordered this same paddle after trying mine out. It's a great bat - not cheap, but not crazy expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Sendak Seuss

customer_reviews.title: Significant Improvement.
customer_reviews.text: The quickest way to improve your ping pong game is with a good paddle. I am a recreational player with a table at work, and my Win/Loss ration has gone up significantly after buying this paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Lettire

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my previous STIGA racket, the STIGA Titan, had broke in an accident. I like the hit of this racket, as my serves seem to hit lower and faster than with other rackets including my old Titan, and I feel more power with this racket compared to the Titan. However, it feels somewhat harder to control, and I don't have as much spin generation as I was expecting from this racket. The spin feels no different, or maybe even a little less compared to the STIGA Titan. I play ping pong nearly every day and competitively locally, and have had this paddle for about a month in a half. Somewhat disappointed in this racket.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing paddle! Makes me love ping pong even more!
customer_reviews.text: I'm just getting into ping pong, been using some cheaper stiga paddles. Didn't think it would make a big difference, bought it to leave at my work (because all the paddles there are almost broke) Little did I know that this paddle is amazing, it is effortless to hit the call with force, also amazing spin control. Changed the entire game :) I will note the weight of the paddle is slightly more, and feels like it's up in the paddle not the handle. Took some getting use to, but I'm liking it now. Only 1 complaint, the handle isn't super comfy, the flat in the sides make it feel like your holding a rectangle instead of a round handle.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: It has great control over the ball and serves as a reminder ...
customer_reviews.text: Use this as my daily bat at work. It has great control over the ball and serves as a reminder of how poor of a player I am. The cushion is great, the control superb, and my co-workers hate the spin I'm able to deliver. Great bat built with high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Peoples

customer_reviews.title: A great paddle for players who know how to play
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing table tennis off and on for fun & recreation since I was a teenager. This is my first attempt at using a Carbon fiber element in the game and I absolutely love this paddle! Playing on a table at home, it was obvious to me that the paddle was FAST and dealt a deadly spin when done right. In fact the speed of the paddle was so much better than my existing sets that I had to relearn control of the ball. This paddle is highly recommended for anyone who is not a beginner. Like: Speed, spin and did a great feel. Dislike: Stiga should have included a paddle cover for this awesome paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Pravin Thakur

customer_reviews.title: My Game Picked Up Instantly!
customer_reviews.text: This paddle has significantly improved my game. Today was the first time I used this paddle. I soundly beat 2 people I have not been able to win a single game against. Both times in straight games 2-0, in best of 3 format. I'm still getting used to the response of the paddle. The spin I'm able to create caused a marked increase in mistakes by my opponents. I'm looking forward to improving even more, as I "learn" the characteristics of the paddle. My opponents were like..."that paddle!".
customer_reviews.author: joeinRR

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was quite fast - in 6 days using global expedited shipping. The racket arrived well packaged and no cosmetic issues. Peeling off the protective plastic film on the rubber revealed very bouncy sides with nice sound everytime a ball hits the middle of the racket. Played this morning with the racket and was quite pleased with its performance. Didn’t take long to get used to the racket, the speed & spin is good, no issues with control either. Looks roubustly built, fits in the hand comfortably in shakehand grip & fairly light. It’s a money well spent if you are not into shopping for rubbers & gluing it together to make your custom racket. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DEBASHISH SINHA

customer_reviews.title: It is a piece of C.....p
customer_reviews.text: I hate this racquet! It makes a hollow sound when in contact with the ball. Not worth spending your money on. Very disappointed with this model of Stiga. I am a great fan of Stiga and have purchased many in the past and never had any issues. This one makes a hollow sound like it has cheap wood in the back. It is like playing wiht a plank. I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Great Racket
customer_reviews.text: I put a lot of spin on the ball & this seems to fit what I need. I also like to slam when I get a chance. This is the best racket I have ever owned & if you ask my wife she thinks I've had many -- WAY TOO many ... unless my game gets lots better this will be my last racket. I play 4-5 times a week for 2-3 hours & I get a great workout.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle for the next level
customer_reviews.text: Ive recommended this paddle to two friends already that play very well and are very competitive but they were stuck using the basic paddles. They both got to the next level immediately after playing with this one. As you go up you loose control of course, but the benefits are amazing. I definitely recommend this paddle if you want to go to the next level after the basic one. This paddle is very very close to a custom paddle I have as well. Good rubbers with good spin (as long as you keep it clean).
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, dont fall for fake reviews
customer_reviews.text: This racket is not worth the price. Apart from the wood everything was poorly built, stroke is not even on different areas of racket. Rubber doesn't have enough spin I was expecting. I am surprised by the previous reviews, feel like I got a poor quality knock off. Don't fall for the reviews, get a cheaper one and you will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandeep

customer_reviews.title: Not a great bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: I would like to give it 3.5 stars. I am a recreational player and have been playing with exclusively $15 walmart soft paddles and this hasn't seemed that much better. I notice I have slightly better control, but the rubber is even less sticky than my 2 yr old walmart paddle. Not a bad paddle in any way, but IMO, not worth 60-70 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Porche` C.

customer_reviews.title: Insane
customer_reviews.text: This was the first paddle that I bought other then cheap ones from department stores. To say it is great would be an understatement. The speed is amazing, control is great and the spin is out of this world. It has caused a huge boost to consistency and even as a defensive player it does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Lance M.

customer_reviews.title: New level of playing
customer_reviews.text: My husband is OBSESSED with this paddle. We recently had our truck broken into and they didn't take his paddle and I feel like he hasn't stopped talking about how happy he is they didn't get It. He loves the spin It creates for him, loves the feel of the handle.. just all around a great purchase for a serious ping pong player!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Farucci Metzger

customer_reviews.title: Best pre-built racket I've used
customer_reviews.text: The speed is amazing on this one but i feel like the red side has more speed that the black side, correct me if I'm wrong. Spins like crazy if you know what you're doing Wouldn't recommend for beginners though It's very hard to control and beginners won't be able to utilize it's full potential anyway, It'd be such a waste of money Get a cheaper one first and learn the basics then go for this It's more fun this way and at least you can really feel surprised with how different it's from other cheap rackets It's a good feeling :)
customer_reviews.author: anasdabbar

customer_reviews.title: For under $50, it works!
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to playing table tennis, having a nice paddle makes a world of difference. It takes a lot less movement with the nicer paddles to get the ball moving compared to the cheap four pack of paddles that are sold. And the amount of spin you can put on the ball is remarkably better. If you can get the Stiga Pro Carbon for less than $50, consider it a good deal. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good quality paddle, but not my style.
customer_reviews.text: On the lighter side, this feels like a good quality aggressive paddle. I didn't end up liking it as much because I tend to have more of a balanced style. The ball really rebounds quickly off of this paddle so it feels like it's meant for someone who wants to have the ball recoil quickly without having to exert. If you're someone who likes to hit the ball hard you might find the attack on this to be too strong.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Freedman

customer_reviews.title: This paddle has been well maintained and looks like it is in brand new condition
customer_reviews.text: Rubber on both sides became slick and unplayable after only 4 to 5 months of play. I play 2 to 3 times a week for 1 to 2 hours. The paddle has been cleaned with Spin Refresh by Butterfly and normally this restores my paddles stickiness. Unfortunately, with this paddle the stick is gone. This paddle has been well maintained and looks like it is in brand new condition.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money, advanced amateur quality level.
customer_reviews.text: Paddle with good spin and speed, as promised. It is a bit wild with first use, as far as control. Great for looping and fast attacks. Not the best for quick-reflex blocking, due to aforementioned lower control rating. Handle grip fits nicely in hand. Weight is in the paddle.. I'm thinking I might prefer more weight in the handle for a different balance, but jury is still out on that for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Strike Fear in Competitors Eyes with the Pro Carbon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this racket years ago when it was around $85, but it has lasted 4 years and it still looks new! I do not use it nearly as much as I used to, but each time I get the chance, I make sure to use the Pro Carbon. You might not play well, but you will look AWESOME with this ping pong paddle!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kay

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I play recreation table tennis with friends once or twice a week and have a decent skill level. My older bat was 4 years old and I felt I need a new bat that would give me some speed and loads of spin as well. I read some reviews online and I felt this bat gave me a good balance of both. I've been playing with this bat for around a month now and I have to say I am not disappointed at all with my choice. I certainly have more spin in my shots and control while returning faster drives.
customer_reviews.author: Jaz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent control, spin and speed
customer_reviews.text: Great control, spin and speed. I do not know about the requirement of world class player but I played at state level (India) and I know this will suit 90% of the players at all levels. I tried Butterfly Tennergy 05 too (too much bouncy) but want to stick to this Carbon only. Thanks to STIGA for coming up with such a nice product! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Not at all premium pingpong paddle
customer_reviews.text: This one is very light with very less speed and not at all suitable for offensive players or who like to smash as weight of the blade is very light. Handle wood was not properly fixed and was coming out a bit at the joints therefore returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Kapil

customer_reviews.title: Hand moves slower but Paddle is super good
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is for Intermediate to PRO. As mentioned in product description handling of this paddle is difficult ( 5 on a rage of 1-10) . your hand moves bit slower with this paddle but after few weeks of play you will get used to it. It's difficult to hit quick shots but Paddle is perfect when it comes to move ball around table. spin is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this racket for Intermediate players.
customer_reviews.text: Stiga Pro Carbon is a pretty good racket and it holds good for intermediate players (strictly not for advanced/expert players). Even I recommend this racket for beginners as Timo bol 1000, 3000 does absolutely nothing! This is a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sundar

customer_reviews.title: Tough to control
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on the great reviews. It does have great power and spin but is lacking in control. In fact it was very tough to control and I would rate the control a 1. Will look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Great Racket!
customer_reviews.text: Great Racket, Pros: This is one of the best rackets out there for this price range. The rubber spins a very adequate amount for beginner's/amateurs. The paddle is light, easy to handle, and has a great feeling when hitting it. The speed and control ratings are very high and users will notice a significant difference if coming from any premade racket under 30$. Cons: I've bought this paddle twice and the second time i bought it, it had a slight chip in the handle, and the finish/paint was very rough/bad. However, this did not affect the gameplay and therefore not worth the trouble to exchange it. Summary: Best Paddle out there in this price range!!
customer_reviews.author: BobaIsLife

customer_reviews.title: Great entry paddle
customer_reviews.text: If you want to get a good entry paddle, something for the office or for playing with friends, this is it. It's a clear step above the Butterflys and K-spins at the near price range. This has awesome control and decent speed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Imperfect
customer_reviews.text: The black side of the racquet has a dent, not glued properly. I can play with the racquet, however, it is flawed. If I did not need the racquet this weekend I would most definitely return it. I am really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Binz

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle however, too heavy for my liking
customer_reviews.text: Being a 70 year old male player who plays almost daily, this paddle is too heavy compared to my Stiga Evolution which I really love. I used it a few times and sold it. However, I did have the rubber surfaces on my Evolution changed to a high quality Chinese rubber to increase control.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques125

customer_reviews.title: It's all about control
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best paddles if you want to control the ball. I'm able to place the ball wherever I want with this paddle. Spin has also improved since using this paddle. I have to say it took me 2-3 games to get used to the new paddle but the rubber is awesome, you are in total control.
customer_reviews.author: Catalin

customer_reviews.title: Solid paddle for spin and finesse. A little steep in price compared to others of the same class.
customer_reviews.text: I am an intermediate player. The rubber is definitely sticky, produces good spin. I would say the spin is not 100 but it still solid. The ball jumps off the paddle but not too extreme which is perfect for my game. The wood is surprisingly light which I prefer heavier paddles. The paddle looks pleasing to the eye, does not look cheap. Overall this is a solid paddle for spin and finesse. I would pay around $40 for it, not $65. I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Great racket
customer_reviews.text: I love this racket, it handles very well, is light weight and nicely balanced. I am getting better at my practice really fast with this racket! Great value for the money. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Velvet

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth every penny from an outstanding company
customer_reviews.text: These are top-quality paddles. Light years away from the paddles commonly used in every-day table tennis sets. The contoured handles are superb. These paddles are exceptionally-well constructed, sturdy, and will amp up your game.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Racquet - Excellent for Beginners and intermediates
customer_reviews.text: I bought this racquet since STIGA is known brand and it's Spin and speed quotient for matching what I was looking for in a racquet. I found this racquet to be quite good in hold and feel. The Spin and Speed combination it generates is also excellent. Value for money. Though for advanced players I am not sure if it will meet their needs, considering I am an intermediate players. But I can say the racquet is well worth for beginners and intermediate players.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Way too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a cheaper Stiga racket. It was great, but the rubber was already warn out. I bought that one and it is about 30% heavier. I am playing with it for almost two months every weekened and can't get used to this new weight.
customer_reviews.author: Simon G

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great, I recommend buying a case
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, I recommend buying a case, keeping it clean and dust free is essential to maintaining the stick on the pad. The beauty is when it gets dirty, a little soap and water does the trick and it is good as new
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lieberman

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle, great control both on attack and on defending
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic paddle :) I am an intermediate player and this fits my play style very well. It has great control even against faster players. Highly recommend, no need to go for the more expensive paddles.
customer_reviews.author: Lukas

customer_reviews.title: Speed, Spin and Control are really good
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is very good for intermediate level and above. Your play has to be good to really see the difference and get the worth out of this paddle. If you are an absolute beginner you can probably look for something cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Abhishek

customer_reviews.title: This ping pong paddle it's Amazing..!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down BEST ping pong paddle I have ever had, this is the paddle for YOU if you like to spins while you play, Good control and power with this paddle; also notice that it's a good paddle for defensive and offensive player alike. I would not hesitate to buy it again in the future
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle
customer_reviews.text: great feel and handling. It is not as heavy as some others have pointed out. You are playing table tennis, not writing a five page paper that your tender fingers need tender, feather weight stuff to go on for hours. You will not notice any weight difference if you have played or play table tennis on a regular basis. Have to yet test it with real game time players. Will update this review later.
customer_reviews.author: Satwik D

customer_reviews.title: Up Your Game
customer_reviews.text: This paddle improved my game and made it easier to get some spin on the ball. Have been playing for few months and still a novice. It is pricey though.
customer_reviews.author: DINAH

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: No complaints here. I had started out with a beginner paddle from killerspin for about $25 that lasted me about two years. I decided to upgrade to a better quality paddle and so far I am not disappointed. The grip and control on this is miles better than my last one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Daley

customer_reviews.title: Great product and weight
customer_reviews.text: I have a heavier paddle and I would call this one a medium weight with awesome grip for hand and ball spin. Overall good product. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Elmer Herrera

customer_reviews.title: High quality and gives good control while maintaining top speed and spin
customer_reviews.text: High quality and gives good control while maintaining top speed and spin. It is a bit on the heavier side but greatly enhances quality of my game. I just got it but I hope it lasts at least a few years!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's for an entry-to-intermediate level user
customer_reviews.text: i was really excited at all the reviews on how this racket had really good spin and force and was suited for tournament play, etc., but it really wasn't. It's light, which is probably the only 'advanced' thing about it. The spin isn't great and nor is the speed. The control is decent, but not what you'd expect from a slower racket. It's not bad, but more suited to someone who's advancing from a pure entry-level racket onto a faster one. Definitely not for an intermediate/intermediate-to-advanced player to improve their game, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Careful while packing, the rubber on both sides were pressed.
customer_reviews.text: Guys at STIGA, When you pack the product, make sure you use a softer material or try to make sure the rubber is not pressed in. Mine was on both side, whats the point of the fancy package when its destroying the package. This is a gift, so I don't really know how the paddle is while playing, I just bought it looking at the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Lost all the power on the forehand side in a month
customer_reviews.text: I bought these rackets about a month ago. In less than a month, the forehand side(red side) lost all its power. It is equivalent to a piece of wood now. When I hit the ball with that side, many times, it does not go beyond the net. It is not even consistent. I don't know why this is rated so high. I thought Stiga is a good brand. I already ordered a different brand rackets. I am very disappointed with the quality of these rackets.
customer_reviews.author: Raghu Jagadam

customer_reviews.title: Waste!
customer_reviews.text: I'd really love to give it zero stars, but can't. First one was used twice before the padding started peeling. They sent out a second one and got 4 games into it when again, the rubber started peeling up. Don't waste your money. Poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Isabell

customer_reviews.title: This racket is a game changer, literally
customer_reviews.text: Very good racket, improves tue fame significantly. Very good holding and great touch with the ball, great for spinning. Very responsive
customer_reviews.author: Ram Ziv

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance
customer_reviews.text: I found this table tennis racket really good for the price. It spins the ball a lot and it's quite easy to control. Not heavy. I was using the STIGA Evolution Performance-Level racket and bought this one just out of curiosity and was pleased to notice the difference. This one is of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Biodun

customer_reviews.title: Has good power
customer_reviews.text: An upgrade over my previous paddle. I find it easier to slam with. Better feel of the ball. I do recommend it for moderate to very good players.
customer_reviews.author: MSG1

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Overall Feel
customer_reviews.text: Looks sturdy. Weight is perfect. I like the overall feel on this paddle. Should up my game for better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money. I ended up buying another rocket
customer_reviews.text: Rubbers were very low quality. Avoid this product. Wasted money. I ended up buying another rocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Poor Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Paddle is light and appears to be put together well. The problem is the packaging. It pinches the paddle at the top and leaves an indentation in the rubber. This would be an easy fix but apparently has still not been addressed.. If the packaging was fixed and a non defective product was received then I'm sure this would be a 5 star paddle. The price is good and my old paddle was a STIGA Supreme that I have been able to use for over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for beginners but definitely not for Intermediates
customer_reviews.text: I didnot like the speed of the paddle. I have had better rubbers in my 15yrs of playing Table Tennis. This paddle is neither heavy on spin nor speed. It feels light and spins maybe 4 out of 10 but not enough to win from an intermediate opponent. The speed is worse and you have to put extra effort to smash. Definitely not for intermidiate players. Should be for beginners
customer_reviews.author: Akansha Nidhi

customer_reviews.title: Layers delaminated
customer_reviews.text: After about a week of use, the 2 dark layers of carbon surrounding the balsa wood handle started delaminating. teh glue wasn't holding the layers together. Handle became floppy.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolai Kovalev

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Paddle for all levels
customer_reviews.text: I love this paddle. I'm an intermediate player but feel that this will last me for a long time. It's heavier than you'd imagine and compared to other paddles the handle is just a tad shorter, but it plays extremely well balanced and accurately. I like it more than the Evolution model, which is lighter but I feel a tad less accurate. Pro Carbon is a great paddle to have and I see it's cheaper now than when I bought it. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: VitaminSEA

customer_reviews.title: This is a great paddle I am a rather new player
customer_reviews.text: This is a great paddle I am a rather new player. I started playing in at my work about 2 months ago and I had only won 2 or 3 games in that time. Since I got this paddle I win the majority of the games I play. It is very lightweight and balanced. Its rubber is extremely tacky so it can put some killer spin on the ball. It takes a little getting used to after switching from a normal cheap paddle as you will be hitting the ball a lot harder than you think but once you get past that its all good from there
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Upping your game
customer_reviews.text: Very responsive paddle it takes a bit to adjust now I really enjoy it. I suggest doing drills and limit games until you settle in with it, otherwise you’re going to loose your edge for a while.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the higher cost
customer_reviews.text: High quality paddle in every aspect. Very well made. Be ready for a big adjustment to the basic Stiga paddles. You can use less power in your swing with this heavier pro paddle, but the result far more spin. You'll see twice the spin on serves vs. the basic Stiga. So much more fun with this high end paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle/bat. Gets lots of complement about bounce and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle/bat. Gets lots of complement about bounce and quality of rubber. Able to sub a lot and light weight yet within 50$$ I will buy again in 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better Racket than the user
customer_reviews.text: Fast and powerful, much to much racket for me. I have so much improvement to do. I will likely pull the rubber off one side and put a defensive rubber on it so I can have an attack and a defense. I like the weight and the grip of the handle. I own most of the lower Stiga rackets and this is the first one that I really like, though I seriously need to up my game!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: ball definitely comes off quick, lots of spin, nice weight not for beginners
customer_reviews.author: Melanie L. Schulte

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle
customer_reviews.text: We love these paddles-we have two of them. They hold up well and are very high quality
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle!
customer_reviews.text: I’m intermediate level, love the paddle, great for spins and fast game!
customer_reviews.author: RSB

customer_reviews.title: Great Table Tennis Paddle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband and he loves it! Helps him spin and control the ping pong ball as he plays against competitive coworkers. And he's always sad to play ping pong without this paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Anni

customer_reviews.title: I am getting nice side, back
customer_reviews.text: Top notch paddle. I am getting nice side, back, and top spin with the spongy rubber on this bat. I have several other paddles, made by different manufacturers, and this is my favorite. I am a medium level skill player, and this paddle seems to be improving my game. It is lighter than my other paddles and the grip is decent too. I got mine on sale for 52 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: RobertH

customer_reviews.title: Inspect the product before you ship or put sticker Fragile on the box !!
customer_reviews.text: Verry nice and feel good to play !! Good respond !! Verry happy !!
customer_reviews.author: ion meyer

customer_reviews.title: Light, Good Power, but Disappointing Spin
customer_reviews.text: I like that I received it quickly and it was nice. It's lighter than my Killerspin 400 and thicker. I think I'm still getting used to the thickness, but I'm disappointed in the spin. I can get as much spin if not more from my Killerspin 400 that's 2 yrs old. I do like the increase in power, it pops on my forehand. I'm still floating it off the end with my backhand slice, but if my backhand topspin hit is on that day it has more pop than the older one. So the only disappointment is the spin, but I'm a big spin player. I'm open for any ideas to increase my spin with this racket.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Good racket but no spin
customer_reviews.text: My favorite racket. Light weight, good control, but it generates very little spin.
customer_reviews.author: LOTR

customer_reviews.title: For more serious players
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a high quality paddle. It is given as a present so we will not know more until after Christmas. It did come quickly and in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: speedgolfer

customer_reviews.title: Poor QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: i bought the product and the product quality was not good. This product i feel is a counterfeit from this seller since the rubber was not stuck properly and the gum was leaking out and in between the rubber there was dust stuck between the rubber and the blade an can been seen clearly and cannot be removed without stripping the rubber and sticking it again. I kindly recommend you not to buy from this seller. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost like buying points
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this paddle. I can play with almost any paddle, but this one is exceptionally good. The power and spin that come off this paddle is insane. I am still working on a consistent loop, but this is a thing of beauty when I start hitting it well. I will certainly be purchasing another one soon, so that I have a backup.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Very fragile Broke the first time I dropped it
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight and has nice control but I had barely used it a few times . I dropped it while I was holding it taking to a friend and boom the handle broke into two .I need a refund
customer_reviews.author: aniket

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle-  reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: It offers great spin and control. Light weight, my wife and I both like it very much. I am at borderline advanced level and my wife is at intermediate level.
customer_reviews.author: Ah Yu

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle with excellent grip
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle to hold and play. The play comes natural and has the right Balance of weight and grip.
customer_reviews.author: Ankush Sharma

customer_reviews.title: it is not bad, but the packaging is not good enough to protect it.
customer_reviews.text: Basically, it is not bad, but the packaging is really bad. And there is a big dent on the racket, see picture. I am disappointed with Stiga's quality control. Updated: I just got a new replacement. It is perfect now! Awesome spin and speed. The control is still very good. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Online

customer_reviews.title: I hear it’s not easy to replace the rubbers, but it’s not impossible either.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light. Great grip! Control is harder for sure. Compare to a pro bat from the local big box store and it’s much lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Darren C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid Racquet with Decent Rubber
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid racket. Rubber is adequate for the price (not as much spin as higher end rubbers s expected) and plays well. I would personally prefer a little lighter racket but overall this played well. Plays in line with its price point.
customer_reviews.author: HappyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Hồ for beginner player
customer_reviews.text: Paddle is ok only for beginner. I ưoild Pềct a better one
customer_reviews.author: KHANH N.

customer_reviews.title: Best Paddle Yet!
customer_reviews.text: If you're upgrading from a cheap wooden with rubber on it paddle then this will be a huge difference. It is very light for the amount of foam it has on it and has extreme amounts of grip on it. It also has a lot more power than any paddle I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Ayoub A.

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners but not Pro
customer_reviews.text: This is not pro at all. The spins you get is not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Farhad Ghavami

customer_reviews.title: value for bucks
customer_reviews.text: It's fast rubber, not tacky. Decent spin from near table, very good for looping and topspin at distance. Not for beginners because it takes time to get control. Awesome for blocks and smashes. The blade is light, would have liked slightly on heavier side. Also, I might put some grip bands, feels slipping at times.
customer_reviews.author: numerical g.

customer_reviews.title: Not any different
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't tell the difference between it and my $15 paddle so I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Cents

customer_reviews.title: I love this paddle
customer_reviews.text: I liked how my girlfriend spanks me with it. Also the tack on the paddle gets awesome spin on the ball.
customer_reviews.author: HarambeLyves

customer_reviews.title: PINT SIZED DYNAMO
customer_reviews.text: I am fully satisfied with this little dynamo which is lightweight yet very fast. The size of the paddle could have been a wee bit larger since the ball catches the edges not infrequently. I am an offensive player and it suits me superbly. Opponents frequently reach out for the bat to have a close look which makes me even more proud 😊
customer_reviews.author: Sampathkumar

customer_reviews.title: Light and great control
customer_reviews.text: Definitely sticky and great control, be sure to get a good rubber cleaner to keep it sticky and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos O

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this paddle few weeks back and it is great. I love playing ping pong with this paddle
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this paddle few weeks back and it is great. I love playing ping pong with this paddle. I would definitely recommend this to other customers.
customer_reviews.author: Giri

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle!
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle for the price and it allowed me to elevate my game by being able to add more spin and speed on my shots. The control is also nice and allows me to place shots where I want them. Its a little light compared to my other Stiga paddle I had, but it feels good when contacting the ball. I would recommend this and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome paddle. Sticky when it first arrived which is a good thing but eventually dust gets on it and you'll need to clean it off. I just rub water on it with my fingers to get the dust from sticking to the paddle and wipe it off with a paper towel while wet. If you run a paper towel on it while dry, you'll put more dust/lint on it.
customer_reviews.author: Luckii

customer_reviews.title: but a great quality and excellent playing racket
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. A little light for my tastes, but a great quality and excellent playing racket. Maybe one of the best pre-made paddles offered today for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Silent Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good quality bat
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good quality bat, but a little different to my previous crap bat. Better spin and speed, but less control, so I need time to adapt before coming to a final judgement. Delivery was very good, as was the packaging. Final assessment of the product will be based on personal preferences, but indications are that this judgement will be favourable. Amazon, however, does not manufacture the bat, so it is an irrelevant point.
customer_reviews.author: pacman41

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied with my purchase. The plastic protector seems to be peeled off before, and I wonder if it is used before. The rubber does not have much spin as it is mentioned in the advertisement. The speed is also not that amazing. I expected a higher quality paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Amir Momeni

customer_reviews.title: but once you get used to the speed it will be one of the best pre-made paddles you have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to adapt to because of how much speed is created from this paddle, but once you get used to the speed it will be one of the best pre-made paddles you have ever owned. I'm a spiker and cutter and this paddle worked very well for me. For people who like to curve or control I would suggest building paddles with higher grip on the rubber, while the pro carbon has really well rubber the grip is lacking for curve and control users.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handles great, even with defects.
customer_reviews.text: Paddle is fast and spin is good. Took it out of the package and has a dent defect under the rubber padding. See picture.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Sicat

product_meta.title: STIGA Pro Carbon Performance-Level Table Tennis Racket with Carbon Technology for Tournament Play
product_meta.description: The STIGA ProCarbon is a perfect blend of cutting-edge technologies and advanced materials. The ProCarbon will allow you to experience the extreme power and spin found in rackets of the top players around the world. This performance-level table tennis racket features ITTF approved rubber for tournament play with performance ratings of Speed: 99, Spin: 100, and Control: 80. The ProCarbon features a 7-ply extra light blade with S5 rubber and 2mm sponge. The Carbon Technology creates power and speed and the ACS Technology increases control. STIGA – Play the best!
feature_bullets: ITTF Approved Rubber for Tournament Play
Features Carbon Technology for Power and Speed
7-Ply Extra Light Blade, S5 Rubber, and 2mm Sponge

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
